excerpt: Scenic mountainside vista offers a sweeping panorama of the surrounding valleys & mountains.
detail_description: The Rossfeld Panorama Strasse is a picturesque mountain road that spans 15.4 kilometers along the high alpine terrain, offering breathtaking views of the Berchtesgaden Alps, Dachstein Massif, and Salzkammergut. It is the highest panoramic road in Germany, reaching an altitude of 1,600 meters with winding hairpin turns.
name: Rossfeld Panorama Strasse

excerpt: Family-friendly tours of a 1500s salt mine with miners' slides, a salt lake & illuminated grotto.
detail_description: Salt Mine Berchtesgaden offers a family-friendly tour of a 1500s salt mine, featuring miners' slides, a salt lake, and an illuminated grotto. Once owned by Berchtesgaden's princely rulers, the mine now welcomes visitors to experience its rich history. The hour-long tour includes a ride on a miniature train deep into the mountain, where an enormous chamber reveals the mining process.
name: Salt Mine Berchtesgaden
address: Parkplatz Salzburger Straße 24 Gästeeinfahrt, Bergwerkstraße 83, 83471 Berchtesgaden, Germany

excerpt: Schönau am Königssee is a municipality in the district of Berchtesgadener Land in the German state of Bavaria. It is located at the northern end of the Königssee lake. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Schönau am Königssee is a charming municipality situated in the district of Berchtesgadener Land, Bavaria, Germany. It is positioned at the northern tip of the picturesque Königssee lake. The area is renowned for its natural beauty and outdoor activities. One of its famous landmarks is the Watzmann, the third-highest mountain in Germany, which attracts rock climbers due to its impressive Ostwand (East Face).
name: Schönau am Königssee

excerpt: Hitler's former mountain-top base reached by elevator, now the site of a restaurant with views.
detail_description: Perched at an elevation of 1834m, The Eagle's Nest was originally built as a mountain retreat for Hitler and has since been repurposed into a restaurant with stunning panoramic views. Accessible only by a special shuttle bus from the Kehlsteinhaus bus station, this historic site boasts a rich World War II history and was once used by top officials of the Third Reich regime.
name: The Eagle's Nest

detail_description: Schloss Berchtesgaden, once a medieval monastery and later the summer residence of the Bavarian royal family, is now home to a permanent collection of rare family treasures. The fine Renaissance rooms showcase sacred art, including wood sculptures by renowned late-Gothic artists. Visitors can explore two weaponry rooms displaying hunting tools and rifles from the 19th century, as well as enjoy the beautiful rose garden on the grounds.
name: Schloss Berchtesgaden

detail_description: The Watzmann Therme in Berchtesgaden offers a unique blend of relaxation, wellness, and sports activities across its 900 square meters of water surface. The architecture seamlessly integrates with the picturesque surroundings, inspiring the diverse range of thermal offerings. After an adventurous day exploring the area's hiking trails and scenic routes, visitors can rejuvenate their tired bodies in warm saltwater or saunas while enjoying breathtaking mountain views.
name: Watzmann Therme

excerpt: Berchtesgaden is a German town in the Bavarian Alps on the Austrian border. South of town, Hitler’s Eagle’s Nest retreat, the Kehlsteinhaus, has a restaurant with alpine views. The Dokumentation Obersalzberg museum chronicles the Nazi era. Salzbergwerk Berchtesgaden illuminates the salt mine’s 500-year history. Lifts lead to Obersalzberg and Rossfeld ski areas. To the south, trails cross Berchtesgaden National Park.
detail_description: Berchtesgaden is a charming German town nestled in the Bavarian Alps near the Austrian border. It's known for historical sites like Hitler’s Eagle’s Nest retreat and the Dokumentation Obersalzberg museum, which delve into the Nazi era. The area also features Salzbergwerk Berchtesgaden, a salt mine with a 500-year history, and ski areas like Obersalzberg and Rossfeld.
name: Berchtesgaden

excerpt: Gondola & lift system in a winter-sports resort & scenic summer hiking & climbing region.
detail_description: Jennerbahn is a gondola and lift system located in Berchtesgaden, offering access to a winter sports resort and scenic summer hiking and climbing region. The area features five downhill skiing areas, including Obersalzberg, Gotschen, Hochschwarzeck, Rossfeld, and Jenner. Visitors can also enjoy ski touring in the Alps. The Jenner peak at 1874 meters offers unparalleled views of the Watzmann and Konigssee.
name: Jennerbahn

detail_description: Located north of Berchtesgaden in the stunning Alps, Wallfahrtskirche Maria Gern is a picturesque pilgrimage church that has stood for centuries despite harsh weather. This baroque church was constructed during the Reformation and offers breathtaking views of the Watzmann massif. It's a prime spot for photographers, especially in the morning when the first light hits the mountains. Visitors can also enjoy hiking trails in the area, with one leading to a beautiful gorge. While St.
name: Wallfahrtskirche Maria Gern

detail_description: Eagles Nest Bus Parking, also known as the Kehlsteinhaus, is a popular destination with a rich history. Situated on the Kehlstein mountain in Obersalzberg, it was once used by Hitler as a teahouse. To reach Eagles Nest, visitors can park at the Documentation Center and board a bus from there. The center also serves as a museum and departure point for buses heading to Eagles Nest.
name: EAGLES NEST BUS PARKING.

excerpt: Visitor centre & museum with multimedia exhibits on the Berchtesgaden Alps, plus a cinema & library.
detail_description: The House of Mountains, also known as the Berchtesgaden National Park Centre, is a captivating visitor center and museum that offers an immersive experience for those interested in learning about the Berchtesgaden Alps. The center features multimedia exhibits, a cinema, and a library where visitors can explore the rich history and natural beauty of the area. The award-winning exhibitions include interactive movies that showcase the stunning landscapes of the Konigsee, Bavarian forests, and mountain peaks within the national park.
name: House of Mountains

excerpt: Simple rooms in an alpine-style chalet & annexes with a toboggan run & an unfussy restaurant.
detail_description: Nestled in the picturesque alpine surroundings, Sommerrodelbahn offers a thrilling 2,000-foot-long toboggan run accessible via the Obersalzburg Cable Car. The ride provides breathtaking views of the Bavarian Alps as you speed down the mountain. After each exhilarating descent, your cart is automatically shuttled back to the top for more fun.
name: Sommerrodelbahn

detail_description: Salzbergwerk, Berchtesgaden offers an entertaining and worthwhile experience, despite being a bit pricey. Visitors are not allowed to take photos inside the mine.
name: Salzbergwerk, Berchtesgaden

excerpt: Center for study, remembrance & debates on National Socialism, with permanent & temporary exhibits.
detail_description: Located near the bus station that takes visitors to the Eagles Nest, Dokumentationszentrum Obersalzberg is a museum dedicated to studying and remembering the history of National Socialism. Once a summer retreat for senior Nazis, including Hitler, this area became a significant seat of Nazi power during the Third Reich. The museum's exhibits cover various aspects of Nazi terror, from the forced takeover of the area to Hitler's racial politics and foreign policy.
name: Dokumentationszentrum Obersalzberg

detail_description: Enzianbrennerei Grassl is a must-visit for adults looking to experience a regional specialty. The distillery offers guided tours that provide insight into the fascinating process of distilling mountain herbs and roots. Visitors can sample a wide variety of unique alcoholic beverages, including their popular gin. The friendly staff are knowledgeable and offer informative commentary while providing samples for tasting. This is the perfect place to try out local specialties and take home some tasty souvenirs.
name: Enzianbrennerei Grassl / Distillery

detail_description: Obersalzberg is home to the Eagles Nest, also known as Kehlsteinhaus, a historic teahouse located on a mountain near Berchtesgaden in Bavaria, Germany. Constructed by the Nazis in 1938, this remarkable structure sits at an elevation of 1834m and is accessible via stunning alpine roads spanning 17 kilometers. Today, it operates as a restaurant offering visitors breathtaking panoramic views of both Germany and Austria.
name: Obersalzberg

excerpt: 6,171-ft. mountain with hiking trails, a restaurant/inn at its summit & panoramic views of the Alps.
detail_description: Perched atop the 6,171-ft Kehlstein mountain, Kehlsteinhaus, also known as Eagle's Nest, was originally constructed by the National Socialists in 1938. This historical site offers panoramic views of the Alps and served as a representation building for the Nazis. Today, it houses a restaurant and inn where visitors can enjoy breathtaking vistas of Germany and Austria. The area also features hiking trails that lead to this iconic mountaintop destination.
name: Kehlstein

detail_description: Berchtesgaden - Obersalzbergbahn GmbH offers a unique gondola ride with its 70-year-old Obersalzbergbahn. The 1530-meter long journey takes approximately 12 minutes and leads to a great hiking base at Karl Von Linde Weg. The nostalgic mountain train provides an unforgettable experience, and the friendly staff adds to the pleasant atmosphere.
name: Berchtesgaden - Obersalzbergbahn GmbH

detail_description: If you're planning a visit to the fascinating Parkplätze Salzbergwerk, you'll find it conveniently located near the entrance to the mine. The parking area is spacious and offers easy access for those heading to explore the saltworks or embark on hiking adventures in the surrounding area. Payment at the machine is straightforward, accepting EC cards and Maestro, which eliminates any hassle of needing small change.
name: Parkplatz Salzbergwerk

detail_description: Dokumentation Obersalzberg in Berchtesgaden is located near the Kehlstein, a popular peak in the German Alps. The site offers insights into a dark chapter of history and its impact on the region. Visitors can explore exhibits and learn about the historical significance of this area. The nearby Kehlstein provides stunning views of the surrounding alpine landscape, making it a must-visit for nature enthusiasts and history buffs alike.
name: Dokumentation Obersalzberg, Berchtesgaden

detail_description: Haus der Berge, located in Berchtesgaden National Park, is a modern and interactive educational center that offers a unique Alpine experience. It's more than just a museum; it's an opportunity to explore what makes the Alps special. The friendly staff welcomes visitors of all ages and there are multimedia exhibits that allow for hands-on exploration. The entry fee is quite affordable, especially with the guest card discount.
name: Haus der Berge, Berchtesgaden

detail_description: Almbachklamm is a picturesque gorge near the village of Marktschellenberg, offering a 2-kilometer hike through stunning natural scenery. The trail features catwalks, bridges, and narrow paths alongside a beautiful green-blue stream with numerous waterfalls. While the hike provides impressive viewpoints and is perfect for hot days, it's important to note that there are sections without guardrails.
name: Almbachklamm

detail_description: Eagles Nest Historical Tours offers a visit to the complex that once housed top Nazi generals and includes a vast underground bunker network. The famous Eagles Nest retreat, although rarely visited by Hitler, is now accessible via a bus ride. The area has some ruins, an excellent museum, and bunkers open for public exploration. A local guide provides in-depth information about the history, local customs, activities, hiking, shopping, and self-guided tours.
name: Eagles Nest Historical Tours

detail_description: Berghof, once the mountain retreat of Adolf Hitler, was a beautiful chalet that hosted not only Hitler but also his companion Eva Braun, her friends, and the families of Nazi officials. Although the original Berghof no longer stands due to bombing during World War II, visitors can stay at Hotel zum Turken nearby and explore underground bunkers that once connected to Hitler's residence.
name: Berghof

excerpt: Bavarian specialties, roast meats & strudels in old-fashioned dining rooms, plus a beer garden.
detail_description: Bräustüberl is a historic beer hall in Berchtesgaden, dating back to 1645, offering a true taste of Bavarian cuisine and culture. The traditional dining rooms and beer garden provide the perfect setting to savor Bavarian specialties such as schnitzels, wursts, sauerkraut, and frankfurters.
name: Bräustüberl

excerpt: Bavarian fare & draft brews served in a 16th-century structure with a beer garden.
detail_description: Gasthof Neuhaus is a historic restaurant located in Berchtesgaden, Bavaria, Germany. It offers traditional Bavarian cuisine and draft beers within a 16th-century building, complete with a charming beer garden for outdoor dining. The menu features authentic German dishes such as pork knuckle, Bavarian duck with orange sauce, red cabbage, and potato dumplings. Vegetarian options like potatoes, pumpkin soup, and knudels are also available.
name: Gasthof NEUHAUS

detail_description: Hofbrauhaus Berchtesgaden GmbH is a historic beer hall that dates back to 1645 and is part of the Hofbrauhaus chain. It offers an authentic Bavarian experience with traditional food, lively sing-alongs to live music, and the opportunity to enjoy a 1-liter beer. The brewery also hosts special events like Bierstacheln during New Year's Eve.
name: Hofbrauhaus Berchtesgaden GmbH

detail_description: Kirchleitn Kapelle, nestled against the stunning backdrop of the Watzmann massif, has become a beloved landmark in Berchtesgaden and is one of Bavaria's most photographed buildings. It offers a great spot for capturing night shots and provides a peaceful retreat from the town where visitors can relax on benches while admiring the breathtaking mountain views. Accessible without special gear, this picturesque chapel also offers an idyllic setting for weddings.
name: Kirchleitn Kapelle

detail_description: Kneifelspitze is a popular hiking trail in Berchtesgadener Land, Bavaria, offering panoramic views of the Berchtesgaden Alps from its 1189m peak. The Kneifelspitze mountain restaurant, also known as Paulshutte, is a must-visit throughout the year. The steep and sometimes slippery trail can be challenging, but the rewarding view and refreshments at the top make it worthwhile.
name: Kneifelspitze

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Berchtesgaden, the Innenstadt is a charming and picturesque area that captures the essence of this historic town. While it may be small, its quaint streets are lined with delightful shops, stylish cafes, and inviting restaurants that reflect local traditions. Visitors often find joy in simply wandering through this vibrant center, soaking up the serene atmosphere and enjoying beautiful sights.
name: Innenstadt

detail_description: The Berchtesgaden National Park Administration Building, also known as the House of the Mountains, is a visually striking former hotel that now serves as a visitor center and museum dedicated to Berchtesgaden and the Alps. The building offers a range of hiking challenges for enthusiasts of all levels, ensuring there's something for everyone regardless of skill level.
name: Berchtesgaden National Park Administration Building

detail_description: The charming and traditional Obersalzbergbahn Bergstation cable car provides a leisurely ascent, albeit with some waiting time due to its slower pace. Fortunately, the lack of crowds makes the wait bearable. However, there is a mid-way cart switch that can be confusing as there is no staff present to inform passengers. Nevertheless, the ride offers breathtaking views and a refreshing atmosphere. The short 5-10 minute journey from the base station to the middle stop proves worthwhile.
name: Obersalzbergbahn Bergstation

detail_description: Museum Schloss Adelsheim is a local museum located just a short walk from the Berchtesgaden Salt Mine. Housed in a building dating back to 1614, it offers an in-depth look at the lives of the people living between Watzmann and Untersberg through its 13 rooms. Visitors can explore exhibits showcasing the skilled craftsmanship of Berchtesgaden artisans, including intricate woodwork with patterns as small as one and a half millimeters high.
name: Museum Schloss Adelsheim

detail_description: Originally constructed in 1596 by a prosperous merchant family, the Hirschenhaus is renowned for its magnificent frescoed frontage, depicting human vices and miseries through the clever use of monkeys. Situated right on the market square, this grand building, formerly known as Gasthof zum Hirschen, boasts an impressive facade adorned with outstanding Luftlmalerei.
name: Hirschenhaus

detail_description: Spa Garden Berchtesgaden is a small and charming park that gives off a secret garden vibe as you enter through its gate. The space is well-balanced, featuring trees, a fountain, and colorful flowers. A small monument can be found next to the gate on the right side. Visitors can enjoy a peaceful atmosphere and relax in this well-maintained area. Additionally, there are free books to read and a quaint little shop available.
name: Kurgarten Berchtesgaden

detail_description: The Frau-Kind-Fisch-Brunnen is a beautifully designed fountain that captivates visitors with its charming appearance. Although there is no information about the artist, donor, or symbolic meaning, it remains an intriguing sight to behold.
name: Frau-Kind-Fisch-Brunnen

detail_description: The Eisstadion is an enjoyable venue that offers a delightful atmosphere for ice skating enthusiasts. This rink provides a thrilling and exciting experience, attracting a vast number of visitors. With its superb facilities and fantastic ambiance, individuals can engage in this popular winter sport with great pleasure. The Eisstadion truly stands out as a remarkable location where people can have fun on the ice, creating lasting memories in an incredible setting.
name: Eisstadion
